isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - PRINCIPLES, OPERATION AND SERVICE - OPERATION - NORMAL BRAKING FRONT AXLE (STEERING AXLE)

svcproc.title: NORMAL BRAKING FRONT AXLE (STEERING AXLE)
svcproc.para: During normal braking, air pressure from the brake valve (foot valve) is applied to the quick release valve (QRV). Air from the QRV is then sent to the right and left front wheel modulator valves.

The antilock modulators then deliver the brake air pressure to the brake actuators. The service brakes are thus applied. If the wheel sensors do not detect an imbalance (impending wheel lockup), the controller does not initiate any corrective action and the vehicle comes to a stop in a normal fashion.
